intro: Tithymalus adrianus, commonly known as the Adrian tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky and coastal environments. The plant features slender stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, contributing to its characteristic scent. Tithymalus adrianus is often found in sunny, well-drained soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
